text: <a href="../2-Samuel-8-1/" title="2 Samuel 8:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them: and David took Methegammah out of the hand of the Philistines.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-2/" title="2 Samuel 8:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And he smote Moab, and measured them with a line, casting them down to the ground; even with two lines measured he to put to death, and with one full line to keep alive. And *so* the Moabites became David's servants, *and* brought gifts.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-3/" title="2 Samuel 8:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 David smote also Hadadezer, the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as he went to recover his border at the river Euphrates.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-4/" title="2 Samuel 8:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And David took from him a thousand *chariots*, and seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David houghed all the chariot *horses*, but reserved of them *for* an hundred chariots.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-5/" title="2 Samuel 8:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succour Hadadezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-6/" title="2 Samuel 8:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus: and the Syrians became servants to David, *and* brought gifts. And the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-7/" title="2 Samuel 8:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
<a href="../2-Samuel-8-8/" title="2 Samuel 8:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And from Betah, and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, king David took exceeding much brass.
<a href="../2-Samuel-8-9/" title="2 Samuel 8:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 When Toi king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer,

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-10/" title="2 Samuel 8:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Then Toi sent Joram his son unto king David, to salute him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer, and smitten him: for Hadadezer had wars with Toi. And *Joram* brought with him vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass:

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-11/" title="2 Samuel 8:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Which also king David did dedicate unto the LORD, with the silver and gold that he had dedicated of all nations which he subdued;

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-12/" title="2 Samuel 8:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Of Syria, and of Moab, and of the children of Ammon, and of the Philistines, and of Amalek, and of the spoil of Hadadezer, son of Rehob, king of Zobah.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-13/" title="2 Samuel 8:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And David gat *him* a name when he returned from smiting of the Syrians in the valley of salt, *being* eighteen thousand *men*.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-14/" title="2 Samuel 8:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And he put garrisons in Edom; throughout all Edom put he garrisons, and all they of Edom became David's servants. And the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
<a href="../2-Samuel-8-15/" title="2 Samuel 8:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And David reigned over all Israel; and David executed judgment and justice unto all his people.

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-16/" title="2 Samuel 8:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And Joab the son of Zeruiah *was* over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud *was* recorder;

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-17/" title="2 Samuel 8:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, *were* the priests; and Seraiah *was* the scribe;

<a href="../2-Samuel-8-18/" title="2 Samuel 8:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada *was over* both the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David's sons were chief rulers.
